components/comparisons.comparisons.html:
The Framework Advantage

@for (row of comparisons(); track row.metric) { }
Feature Angular Libraries (React/Vue)
{{ row.metric }} {{ row.angular }} {{ row.others }}

thumb_up Pros

  • "Batteries included" - Router, Http, Forms built-in
  • Consistent architecture across teams/projects
  • Powerful CLI for scaffolding and updates
  • TypeScript by default = better maintainability

warning Cons

  • Steeper initial learning curve
  • More boilerplate than lightweight libraries
  • Can be overkill for simple static sites

components/performance.performance.html:
Unmatched Performance

flash_on

Signals & Fine-Grained Reactivity

Angular creates a dependency graph of your data. When a signal changes, only the specific DOM elements bound to it update. No Virtual DOM diffing overhead.

speed

Deferrable Views

Declarative lazy loading with the new @defer block. Load heavy components only when they enter the viewport.

water_drop

Hydration & SSR

Non-destructive hydration reuses DOM nodes created by the server, improving LCP and CLS metrics significantly.

performance-demo.html
<!-- Lazy loads the chart when user sees it -->
@defer (on viewport) {{ '{' }}
<heavy-chart [data]="sales()" />
{{ '}' }} @placeholder {{ '{' }}
<div class="skeleton">Loading...</div>
{{ '}' }}

<!-- Updates DOM without checking entire tree -->
<span>Total: {{ '{{' }} total() {{ '}}' }}</span>
Bundle Size

T T I
0.4s
